messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Author Alfie Kohn again - WAS I'm  on the verge!...
messages.msgSnippet: ... Par for the course. They talk about education reform all the time, but most of what they do makes things worse. Tia
messages.messageBody:
>They are mind-bending. I read his anti-competition book in the 80's. It
>was in the Ministry of Education library near the Legislature in Victoria.
>I was a co-op student. IRONIC or what! :O))

Par for the course. They talk about education reform all the time, but most
of what they do makes things worse.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Author Alfie Kohn again - WAS I'm on the verge!...
messages.msgSnippet: They are mind-bending.  I read his anti-competition book in the 80 s.  It was in the Ministry of Education library near the Legislature in Victoria. I was a
messages.messageBody:
They are mind-bending. I read his anti-competition book in the 80's. It was in the Ministry of Education library near the Legislature in Victoria. I was a co-op student. IRONIC or what! :O))


----- Original Message -----
From: Tia Leschke
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, October 25, 2003 11:35 AM
Subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] I'm on the verge!...



>
>
>Your comments remind me of Alfie Kohn. A colleague of mine saw he do a
>keynote at a conference. His message was sort of like this:
>
>"We want learning to be about trial and error, not reward and
>punishment. R&P leads to dependence. T&E leads to wisdom/freedom.

Funny. I keep meaning to read his books. <g> I tried one of them and
didn't get into it. I've meant to try again. But I guess I passed the test,
and now I don't need to. %^)
Tia
